column4: 02:04.0 Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4318 [AirForce One 54g] 802.11g Wireless LAN Controller (rev 02) <-- I've got the president's wireless card!!!
heh, same card I have
does it work for you? :-/
yep, both on ubuntu (automatic) and gentoo, (I manually configured it)
doesn't work for me :-/
alright, hang on a moment let me get my settings for you
please.
gutsy
it doesn't for me
I mean, the card gets detected and everything.
it even connects to the AP
alright, open a terminal
but it won't get an IP from the DHCP server
sounds like you don't have dhcpcd
dhcp client is there.
please open a terminal, and type in iwlist eth1 scan
if you can scan using the card, then the problem is not the card :)
I can scan, yes.
are you able to connect to an accesspoint?
yup.
but it eventually fails.
hit the connect, it's telling me its connecting then it fails
better, please put the output of iwlist eth1 scan into a pastebin?
the card works, seems like you have problems with your network key. I know the card works because I have the exact same thing working in two different linux operating systems.
